main event: On 16 May 1949, at approximately 1700 hours, a military auto mechanic stationed at Davis-Monthan AFB in Tucson, Arizona, observed a solid, round, flat black object in the sky, flying directly from east to west, approximately 5,000 feet above the ground at a speed estimated to be about 800 to 1,000 m.p.h. The object appeared to be about three to four feet in diameter, maintained the same altitude, and fluttered as it disappeared behind an obstacle.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a wash tub, solid black, and appeared to be traveling at a very high speed of 800 to 1,000 m.p.h.
It flew directly over the AFB, maintaining a constant altitude of approximately 5,000 feet and fluttered as it disappeared behind an obstacle.
No exhaust, sound, or lights were observed, and the object never came in contact with the surrounding clouds.
The witness, a military automobile mechanic, was described as trustworthy, above average in intelligence, and sincere, with no moratory traits in his character.
The investigation did not reveal any other witnesses or possible explanations for the observed object.
sighted object: A solid, round, flat black object, approximately three to four feet in diameter, flying from east to west at 5,000 feet altitude
witnesses: A military auto mechanic stationed at Davis-Monthan AFB, witnessed by other airmen who did not reach the window in time to see the object
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
